content:
I am a recent graduate from the Electrical Engineering and Computer Science undergraduate major at UC Berkeley. Along with my knowledge of programming languages such as Python, Java, and C, I have experience with data structures and algorithms, machine learning, controls, and robotics. I am very interested in reinforcement learning and its applications in controls for robotic systems and am always working on researching more into these fields. Aside from my career concentration, I have also enjoyed being an academic intern for the CS61B course, working as an officer of the HKN Mu Chapter, and relaxing through sports such as intramural soccer and Cal Hurling.
 --Here is a link to my resum√©.
summary: I am a recent graduate from the Electrical Engineering and Computer Science undergraduate major at UC Berkeley. Along with my knowledge of programming languages such as Python, Java, and C, I have experience with data structures and algorithms, machine learning, controls, and robotics.
title: Shreyas Agarwal

summary: Research and development of a Predicted Endpoint Conditioned Network (PECNet) in the setting of multi-modal pedestrian trajectory forecasting with consideration of physical and social constraints. Led by Professor Jitendra Malik at UC Berkeley's BAIR Lab. Publication and Oral Presentation at ECCV 2020.
title: It Is Not the Journey but the Destination: Endpoint Conditioned Trajectory Prediction

content:
Abstract:
The problem of shape formation in decentralized swarms has been tackled in many ways. However, most methods must make a choice between providing well-planned paths or low runtime results. In this paper, we evaluate an algorithm by Wang and Rubenstein that provides low runtime results by sampling from discrete space, and develop a continuous version of this algorithm. We analyze theoretical safety guarantees of this algorithm and compare its performance to the discrete version using metrics such as runtime, total distance traveled by the swarm, and efficiency. We also implement an asynchronous decentralized swarm simulator to run experiments and verify results.

summary: Decentralized control research of robotic agents. Implemented in discrete space and extended to continuous space.
title: Decentralized Swarm Robotics: Discrete vs Continuous Shape Formation of Swarm Robotics
